Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I have a circular lighter patch on my right cheek where a mole used to be.

No, I don't have any family history of skin conditions or diseases.

No, I haven't experienced any itching, pain, or sensitivity in the area.

No, I haven't been exposed to significant sun exposure or used tanning beds.
**Final Diagnosis:** Vitiligo.
